adjective.description: Relating to, denoting, or preserving the character of an early stage in the evolutionary or historical development of something.
examples: a name corrupted from primitive German

adjective.description: Having a quality or style that offers an extremely basic level of comfort, convenience, or efficiency.
examples: the accommodations at the camp were a bit primitive

adjective.description: Not developed or derived from anything else.
examples: the primitive material of the universe

adjective.description: (of a part or structure) in the first or early stage of formation or growth; rudimentary.

noun.description: A person belonging to a preliterate, nonindustrial society.
A word, base, or root from which another is historically derived.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense original, not derivative): from Old French primitif, -ive, from Latin primitivus first of its kind, from primus first.
